title: Fix negatively-sized rectangles in treemap.
body: Includes unit test!

title: Remove some stray globals in d3.behavior.*.
Remove invalid octal constants.
body: 08 and 09 are not legal octal constants according to ECMA-262, although they seem to work fine in V8.  I removed other octal constants too for good measure, but retained alignment where appropriate.

title: D3 all target for installation
body: Not sure whether adding a semicolon after each one is acceptable, otherwise can redo with the `cat a semicolon b` trick.

title: Auto-update version number in package.json.
Prevent click events on drag in zoom behaviour.
body: You have to hold the mouse quite still though for a "true" click to register (see the zoom-pan example).  Perhaps we should have a small allowance for jittery mice?

title: "psuedo" -> "pseudo".
Add d3.behavior.drag.
body:
Note: this introduces a dependency on d3.behavior to d3.layout.force if used (in addition to the existing dependency on d3.geom).

I toyed with having `event.translate` to be consistent with the zoom behaviour, but I think using position will be far more common, and an offset can be easily computed if needed.

title: Add missing semicolon.
Fix for empty children with tree layout.
Fix example index layout for Opera.
body:
It currently looks like this for me in Opera 11.50 on OS X:

![](http://www.jasondavies.com/tmp/Screen%20Shot%202011-08-19%20at%2011.39.45.png)

title: Don't trigger mousemove on mouseup in force layout.
body:
Avoids a spurious layout restart if the mouse hasn't moved.

Fixes #207.

title: Fix division by zero in partition
body: This patch fixes a smal problem with d3.layout.partition. If there is a node whose value is zero and which has some children, each child's `dx` will become NaN because of division by zero.

title: zindex selection method that handles SVG
body:
The quirk of SVG not supporting `z-index` has come up a few times in the group:

```
http://groups.google.com/group/d3-js/browse_thread/thread/9480326bbd980459
http://groups.google.com/group/d3-js/browse_thread/thread/a3f47cbeb1043892
```

And the correct answer seems to be, "use sort to reorder the SVG nodes".
This is a selection method that just does that for SVG, and otherwise calls style().

If you think this is okay, we should probably put a little check in the style() to call this function so people can use either

```
.style("z-index", ...)
```

or

```
.zindex(...)
```

Also please let me know if there are any style guides / pull request etiquette for D3---I looked around but couldn't find anything.

title: Missing comma
Fix handling of zero-sized nodes.
body:
Previously, negative or zero sizes were short-circuiting the worst() function by always returning Infinity, instead of being ignored for the score computation.

I've had to add a check for `s` to prevent `0/0` when computing the score for a single zero node too.

Fixes #233.

title: Time Scale Refinements
body: I've added two functions to the time scale setup: interval and intervalFormat. They allow you to make ticks at particular time intervals (e.g. every month or every hour) and to label those ticks uniformly, instead of defaulting to the highest-order label.

title: Improve IE9 compatibility
body:
This adds simple patches for IE9 support by patching Array.map and 
creating a simple workaround for {elt}.style.setProperty() which IE9
doesn't support.

IE9 does not support {elt}.style.setProperty(name,value,priority)
but this can be worked around using
{elt}.style[name] = value

Tested examples/ with this in place and every example I checked
worked in IE9 (specifically, this fixes bar, bullet, albers, force directed graphs,
which don't work without the patch).

Thanks.

title: Add support for padding to treemap layout.
body:
The new "padding" property is an array of [top, right, bottom, left], or a function that returns such an array for a given node.

I had to change the internal `scale()` function too for this to work as the areas need to be recomputed one level at a time, instead of recursively all at once.  It seems more elegant to take an array of child nodes for this reason as that's when it's used.

I modified the example to use padding for testing, but you might want to revert this.

Lastly, is there any point in supporting a single numerical argument as padding for convenience?

title: Fix retrieval of width/height for horizon chart.
Minor optimisation.
body: Noticed this when debugging something else.

title: eliminate "this.parentNode is null" errors
body: verify that the node to remove after a transition actually has a parent node

title: Prevent RangeError in force layout on Safari.
body:
For very large force layouts, Safari was throwing "RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded".  I think this is due to Safari having a smaller call stack than Chrome and FireFox.  In any case, this fix replaces `forEach` with a while loop, which should be faster in all browsers as well as reducing the call stack size needed and thus fixing the Safari issue.

Note that it ignores `undefined` elements of the `quad.nodes` array.  I assumed it's normal for these to be there, as `quad.nodes.forEach` also ignores these elements and perhaps that's why `forEach` was being used.

Thanks to Vicenzo Menanno for noticing this issue!

title: Handle zero and negative values gracefully in treemap layout
body: Fixes #221.

title: allow access of original data when computing arcs in pie layout
Shameless self promotion: add linked treemap to User Gallery page

Kevin

Let me know,

title: Add variable link distance to force layout.
body:
See: #211.

I think this would be useful for implementing a [Dorling Cartogram](http://mbostock.github.com/protovis/ex/cartogram.html).  I've got part of the way there, I just need collision detection now I think.

I can add variable link strengths too in this pull request if this is the right approach.

title: zoom bug: function and var with same name
body:
Changed variable name from `zoom` to `_zoom` because there was a function called `zoom` in the same context.

As discussed in the google group: http://groups.google.com/group/d3-js/browse_thread/thread/87eaa397e7ed9e5b

title: Updated json symlinks for cartogram/choropleth examples
body:

I've updated the symlink to the .json files as these were missed during the move of the data folder to examples.

Cheers.
